page.title: 09A DAY AT THE MAGISTRATES CT.
page.content: At the Magistrates Court they start at 10 am and usually go on until lunchtime.Sometimes they go on until 5 pm. If the case is very serious they will send the defendant to the Crown Court. The cases they get are not always very bad. If you are under 17 and you have committed a crime you get sent to a juvenile court and could get punished. If you are under 17 and you commit a serious crime you could get sent to a detention home centre. If you're over 17 you will be fined. If it is a little bit more serious you could be sent to prision for up to 6 months if the crime is very serious you could be tried in the Crown Court. You could be sent to prison for up to 30 years if necessary.
